Key Match Events: The Minnesota Timberwolves dropped their second straight preseason game, falling 125-123 to the Chicago Bulls.
Pre-Game Insights: According to NBA insider Shams Charania, Anthony Edwards is building a strong relationship with his new teammates, including Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards struggled offensively, shooting 6-for-23 from the field and finishing with 16 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves will cap off their preseason tomorrow against the Denver Nuggets and will open their regular season with a clash against the LA Lakers on Oct. 22.
Others: Julius Randle made his preseason debut for Minnesota, recording 15 points, six rebounds and five assists on 6-for-12 shooting in 26 minutes. Rudy Gobert was dominant inside, posting 13 points and 17 rebounds, while Donte DiVincenzo added 17 points off the bench. Lonzo Ball, making his return after two years, impressed with 10 points in 15 minutes, shooting 4-for-6 from the field, including two 3-pointers.
